Posts.Content: may_flower wrote: I recently noticed that my left nipple retracts when I raise my arm to shave, also when raising my arm over head. This just started a few weeks ago and even happens when the nipple is erect. I have a fibroadenoma that is 1.3cm but stable and also have a simple cyst in that breast that measures 2.7cm that has been there and has grown over the last year. Can these fibrocystic conditions cause this? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Nipple retracts? may_flower may_flower

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2014 10:54AM may_flower wrote: Thank you, Mods. I wasn't sure if benign conditions could cause this, so thanks for the link it's helped put my mind at ease.Â  GrammyR, thanks for your reply. I had a biopsy to confirm the fibroadenoma about 15 months ago and was told it was stable with my mammo/ultrasound at the first of February this year. It does sit somewhat behind the left nipple and areola that's why the sudden nipple retraction caught my attention. I hate hearing they let you go for 3 years without a biopsy. Hope you are in good hands now! I called my gyn this morning and asked for her recommendation to a breast surgeon. Got lucky and have an appointment on May 6th.
Posts.Title: Nipple retracts? may_flower may_flower
